posts.post_content:
I'm on a journey starting today to track down a card of each player who was managed my Carl Molesworth between 1923 and 1925. The hard work has been completed as I know what cards I need plus, thanks to a fellow member, a T211 and T201-8 of Molesworth is set to arrive any day. (These cards are what is driving this search.)

I already have an E103 McQuillan now I only need the 16 other players :eek:. 
Below is my list:

Al Demaree - T222 Fatima Player Cards
Doug Baird - M101-6 Felix Mendlesohn
Duke Kenworthy - 1924 Walter Mails Card Game
Grover Hartley - T207 Brown Background
Hick (Forrest) Cady - T205 Gold Border
Ike Davis - 1928 Zeenut
Mandy Brooks - 1927 M.L. Die Cuts

[STRIKE]George McQuillan - E103 Williams Caramel[/STRIKE]
[STRIKE]Bill Regan - 1928 Star Player Candy[/STRIKE]
[STRIKE]Dick Burrus - 1926 W461-5 Exhibits (Set 5) #18[/STRIKE]
[STRIKE]Eddie Murphy - E145-1 or E145-2 Cracker Jack[/STRIKE]
[STRIKE]Emilio Palmero - 1923 Nacionales Cigarros[/STRIKE]
[STRIKE]Hank Schreiber - 1919 Cincinnati Reds Postcard[/STRIKE]
[STRIKE]Hugh High - 1922 Zeenuts[/STRIKE]
[STRIKE]John Sullivan - E123 Curtis Ireland Candy[/STRIKE]
[STRIKE]Patsy McGaffigan - 1921 Frederick Foto[/STRIKE]
[STRIKE]Reb Russell - WG4 Polo Grounds Game[/STRIKE]

The plan is to acquire 2 cards per month depending on the funds needed to add.

PM or email, [url]shernan30@gmail.com[/url], what you have.

Thanks for looking, 

Steven
Are those the only cards of each player you want (due to their esthetics or any other reason)?

Esthetics is a big one, but I also do not want multiple players with the same issue. After reviewing all the known issues for these players this gives the best mix of issues.


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk
I like the angle or slant if you will... Good Luck!!  He was a Baron in this pic -
